Office Provost Marshal
Shelbyville Ky Mar 7th 1865.
His Excellency
Gov of Ky
Sir

J. W. Vessels has asked me for a recommendation to you, for a Commission and authority to raise a company of men for six months or one year. I did not know ^him^ before he came to this place, in company with Capt Terrill's men. He was a member of Terrill's squad. Terrill disbanded his men yestarday, which leaves this man with a number of Terrill's men here and they desire to rid this country of the Guerrillas, that they can return to their homes. The above is all that I know of this man's history, but I think if he or some one, was granted permission to raise such men, the State could be in a better condition Hoping permission will be granted,

I remain
Respy Your Ob't Serv't
George Petry
D. P. M. Shelby Co Ky.

office Pro. Marshal
